tagrelator.pmi
Class SOCPMI

java.lang.Object
  tagrelator.pmi.SOCPMI

public class SOCPMI
extends java.lang.Object

provides the computation of SOC-PMI values.
a method for computing SOC-PMI value for a word pair W1, W2.
roughly spoken the n-best context words of W1 according to PMI-value, are taken,
and then the PMI-values for these context words with W2 are looked up and added up. the size of n is not set by the user but a matter of the computation itself the precise formulas for SOC-PMI are to be found in the paper
"Second Order Co-occurrence PMI for Determining the Semantic Similarity of Words" from

Author:
Aminul Islam, Diana Inkpen
at time of programming available at http://hnk.ffzg.hr/bibl/lrec2006/pdf/242_pdf.pdf

static java.lang.Double DEFGAMMA
          the default value for the constant parameter Gamma its an exponent in the formula of SOC-PMI the bigger it is, the more emphasis is on high PMI values the default value is according to the referenced paper

w2 is evaluated with the context words of w1
 java.lang.Integer getLastActbeta()
          during computation of SOC-PMI the beta value is evaluated against an index actual beta is at max equal to beta if there are not enough PMI-values, or if they dont satisfy PMI>0 computation stops. the amount used PMI values (actual beta) is used for the computation of the similarity value
 java.lang.Double getLastbeta()
          during computation of SOC-PMI the beta value gets computed, which determines how many context words should maximally be in the n-best list.

DEFDELTA

public static final java.lang.Double DEFDELTA
the default value for the constant parameter Delta it is the same value like referenced paper. it should be set according to corpus size. in the paper a 100mio word corpus is used

delta

private java.lang.Double delta

DEFGAMMA

public static final java.lang.Double DEFGAMMA
the default value for the constant parameter Gamma its an exponent in the formula of SOC-PMI the bigger it is, the more emphasis is on high PMI values the default value is according to the referenced paper

private java.lang.Double gamma
Constructor Detail

SOCPMI

public SOCPMI()
Method Detail

getLastbeta

public java.lang.Double getLastbeta()
during computation of SOC-PMI the beta value gets computed, which determines how many context words should maximally be in the n-best list.
gets updated everytime computeSOCpmi() is called

Returns:
the last beta value or null if no computation has taken place yet

getLastActbeta

public java.lang.Integer getLastActbeta()
during computation of SOC-PMI the beta value is evaluated against an index actual beta is at max equal to beta if there are not enough PMI-values, or if they dont satisfy PMI>0 computation stops. the amount used PMI values (actual beta) is used for the computation of the similarity value

setDelta

public void setDelta(java.lang.Double newDelta)
set your own Delta parameter

setGamma

public void setGamma(java.lang.Double newGamma)

computeSOCpmi

public java.lang.Double computeSOCpmi(java.lang.String w1,
                                      java.util.TreeSet<PMIvalue> pmiW1,
                                      java.lang.String w2,
                                      java.util.TreeSet<PMIvalue> pmiW2,
                                      java.lang.Integer freqW1,
                                      java.lang.Integer typeSize)
computes a SOC-PMI value for a word pair w1, w2
w2 is evaluated with the context words of w1

Parameters:
w1 - first word
pmiW1 - the PMI values for the first word (obtainable with PMI class)
w2 - the second word
pmiW2 - the PMI values for the second word (obtainable with PMI class)
freqW1 - the independent frequency of the first word in the corpus which served as base (obtainable from the RawCounts class)
typeSize - type size of the corpus on which served as base (obtainable from RawCounts class //TODO: make true)
